column3: Please follow the contributing guidelines. i.e write a proper commit message. Don't use the default GitHub message, it's not useful at all.

utACK

Please squash your commits ([see here if you haven't done this before](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits))

Btw, is this PR for hacktoberfest? (based on your PR description)

meshcollider wrote:

> Btw, is this PR for hacktoberfest? (based on your PR description)

Not really, no. I have updated the text accordingly.
Short options should only be a single character.
Any reason this isn't lowercase, like all the other options?
Lowercase `-f` would typically be reserved for "force", though... :/

I'm seeing [test/functional/wallet_hd.py help (in which the lowercase f is being used as short option)][0] being automatically printed after requesting `test/functional/test_runner.py -h`.\n\nUsing an uppercase F here has been a precaution, but in this occasion I would be keen to switch it to lowercase here and deal with a potential arguments conflict later, once and if I'm sure it can happen.\
I would see useful using an "s" for "stop" instead.\n
